concise_definition: n. 背部, 后部; v. 支持, 背书, 退后; adj. 后面的, 逆向的; adv. 向后, 回到原处

definitions.explanation_en: The rear part of the human body or an animal, especially the area from the neck to the hips; also refers to the rear surface of any object.
definitions.explanation_cn: 人体或动物从颈部到臀部的后部区域；也可泛指任何物体的背面。
definitions.example_en: She massaged his back after a long day of work.
definitions.example_cn: 工作了一整天后，她给他按摩了背部。

definitions.explanation_en: To support or endorse someone or something, often publicly or with authority, especially in a political, financial, or competitive context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指公开或以权威身份支持或背书某人或某事物，常用于政治、金融或竞争性语境中。
definitions.example_en: The senator backed the new environmental bill.
definitions.example_cn: 这位参议员支持了这项新的环保法案。

definitions.explanation_en: To move or cause something to move in a reverse direction, away from the front or toward a previous position.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指向后移动，或使某物向后移动，远离前方或回到先前的位置。
definitions.example_en: He backed his car out of the driveway slowly.

definitions.explanation_en: Located at or relating to the rear part of something; not in the front or primary position.
definitions.explanation_cn: 位于或与某物的后部相关；非前方或主要位置。
definitions.example_en: The back door leads to the garden.

definitions.explanation_en: In a reverse direction; to a previous place, state, or condition; used to indicate return or recurrence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 向后方；回到先前的位置、状态或条件；用于表示返回或重现。
definitions.example_en: She went back to her hometown after graduation.

comparison.analysis: “Rear”（后部）与 “back” 在指物体或动物的后部时可互换，但 “rear” 更正式、更常用于技术或军事语境（如 rear window, rear guard），而 “back” 更口语化、使用范围更广，还可用于抽象意义（如 back of the line）。
“Support”（支持）作为动词时，含义与 “back” 的‘支持’义项接近，但 “support” 更中性、广泛，可指情感、经济、物理等多方面支持；而 “back” 更强调立场上的公开背书或政治/商业上的站队，常含主动推动之意。
“Return”（返回）与 “back” 作为副词时都表示回到原处，但 “return” 是正式动词，需搭配介词（return to），而 “back” 作为副词更简洁直接，常用于口语和固定搭配（go back, come back）。此外，“return” 可作名词，而 “back” 无此用法。
